attributes.action: Ban the use of zoos as a tourist attraction
attributes.background: Zoos set a limit on animal freedom, it is wrong that just because we are the dominant and most forward thinking species that we should capture and restraint the freedom of other animals for our own entertainment. I am petitioning to end animal captivity and give every animal the freedom it deserves.
attributes.additional_details: The world is developing at an extremely fast rate and traditions are not the only things fading out. It is estimated that 99% of all species that have lived on earth are now extinct, and over 150,000 become extinct every day. these animals have limited lives as it is, and it isn't right for us as a dominant and prosperous species to constrain the animals to a restricted life in a cage.

attributes.action: Increase the fine on mobile phone use while driving to a minimum of £10,000
attributes.background: I'm sick of having near misses while cycling to and from work due to car drivers illegally using mobile phones while driving. This problem is becoming an epidemic, it's time to get tough on the law breakers who endanger innocent lives.

attributes.action: Change laws on house buying/selling make "accepted offer" legally binding
attributes.background: Currently there is no law or anything legally binding once an offer is accepted, if the buyer pulls out at any time. Which can cause the loss of survey fees and solicitors fees to the buyer. An there is nothing the buyer can do to recoup these costs or any impact on the seller currently.
attributes.additional_details: If this happens a few times this can result in the buyer losing thousands of pounds. A house is one of the biggest expenses and outgoings we incur in our lives. With this uncertainly in can put new buyers off as a house in not guaranteed currently until contracts are completed. An existing home movers off as they just can't take the chance of losing that additional money. Plus the seller and pull out currently with no impact to themselves currently.

attributes.action: Preserve current opt-outs should the UK decide to rejoin the EU in the future.
attributes.background: The UK's recent vote to leave the EU saw young people vote overwhelmingly to remain, making it possible that future public opinion will favour rejoining. To make this process smoother we hereby call upon the government to preserve the UK's current opt-outs for potential future membership.
attributes.additional_details: Opt-outs are when EU Member States decide not to participate in European legislation or treaties. As a member since 1973, the UK opted out of both the Euro and the Schengen Agreement on passport-free movement of people. However, countries wishing to join in future may not opt out of such agreements permanently. Therefore, preserving current opt-outs for a future British application to rejoin the EU would make the terms of future membership more favourable.

attributes.action: Gain funding, raise awareness&reintroduce oral health education back into the UK
attributes.background: I have created this petition to gain support in introducing Oral Health Education back into the UK. As a dental nurse working in the UK I witness the daily effects&trauma that tooth decay in children under the age of 18 causes. I would like to reintroduce OHE into: nurseries,schools&the community.
attributes.additional_details:
Facts and figures:
+ More than 128,000 children under 10 had at least 1 tooth removed since 2011-2016

+ Hospitals are at 'crisis point' for children needing teeth extracted under general anaesthetic

+ £30 million spent on hospital based extractions between 2012-2013 on those aged 18 and under

+ 90% of tooth decay was preventable

+ Dental treatment is FREE for those aged under 18

attributes.action: Change the law on court child access fees
attributes.background: Every time a parent goes against the court order, that parent has to pay £220 to go back to court. It's ridiculous the other parent going against the courts order for access should be charged this fee.
attributes.additional_details: If the parent who went against a court access order was charged the fee or had to re pay the £220 to the aggrieved parent. It's totally wrong that the aggrieved parent has to keep paying this money.  Maybe if the other parent had to pay it, they would not go against court order in the first place.

attributes.action: Get the government to remove stamp duty from buy-to-let property
attributes.background: The btl mortgages have dropped 60% since April when George Osborne brought in the states on btl and 2nd homes. This is damaging the housing market and the rental market for both renters and 1st time buyers

attributes.action: that caravans are only allowed on the public highway between 11pm and 6am.
attributes.background: Caravans are the bane of road users throughout the UK. If they can only travel at night then it will keep the country's roads clear during the day.
attributes.additional_details:
All you have to do is find a slow moving line of traffic in the summer and there will be 1 or 2 monster sized caravans being pulled by some woefully under powered car. To add to it, it will be rammed to the roof with holiday kit.
Get this menace out of the way during the day and keep the traffic moving.

attributes.action: Ban the release of Helium balloons
attributes.background:
Helium is a rare gas, which is becoming scarce, we allow people to release helium filled balloons for memorials/ celebrations / competitions. 
It causes major problems when the balloons deflate for wildlife and in particular aquatic animals. A number of whale deaths are recently attributed to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://balloonsblow.org/
http://www.nabas.co.uk/about-balloons/
http://www.abc.net.au/science/surfingscientist/heliumballoons.htm
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/how-balloon-releases-harm-wildlife/
http://www.mcsuk.org/downloads/pollution/dont%20let%20go.pdf

They are becoming part of the plastic soup we dump into out oceans killing wildlife we cannot continue like this, it a simple start please sign.

attributes.action: Review decision-making process behind closure of nightclubs in the UK.
attributes.background: Following Islington Council's decision last night (6th September) not to renew the license for Fabric, an iconic dance music venue in London, we request that parliament reviews why decisions like this one and others are consistently being made to the detriment of dance and youth music culture.
attributes.additional_details: Fabric holds global significance for dance music, launching the careers of many artists and drawing crowds from all over world. In the last three months several other venues including The Arches, Passing Clouds and Dance Tunnel have also been forced to close. Dance music is an important part of music culture; the closure of places that grow the community, foster innovation and provide a venue to enjoy this music, will lead to the loss of the UK’s status of a breeding ground for musical talent.

attributes.action: Give volunteers similar equality rights as employee's.
attributes.background: As a volunteer in the United Kingdom, an organisation is allowed to dismiss you without giving a reason or even on grounds of discrimination. Volunteers are the backbone of many communities in this country and I believe they should have the same rights as employee's not to be discriminated against.
attributes.additional_details:
As an employee, you have the right not to be discriminated against. If a company dismisses you and you believe they have discriminated in making this decision, you have the right to appeal to an employment tribunal.

As it stands, a volunteer could put in 30 years and if something changes with their circumstances, the organisation can dismiss them. I believe they should be able to appeal this decision to a similar tribunal and volunteering should be covered by all discrimination law.

attributes.action: Stop Mandatory Overtime for Parents of Disabled and Poorly Children
attributes.background: Quite often parents of disabled and poorly children are expected by their employer to work additional hours above the contracted amount, often at short notice. This expectation, if not met, can to lead to poor performance ratings, missed promotion opportunities and sometimes disciplinary action.
attributes.additional_details: For parents of these children being at home to support their family is paramount. Being forced into mandatory overtime can have a severe impact on the child's development, cause stress within a parents relationship and prevent a strong and robust support network for both the child and parent career. Removing the expectation of overtime and allowing parents to opt out of working any additional hours would eliminate stress, reassure the family and set clear boundaries to the employer.

attributes.action: Re-evaluate the Council House Programme
attributes.background: We need to re-evaluate the Council House Programme as Council houses should only be available to those in desperate need of local support and/or because they are facing homelessness (as long as they haven't made themselves intentionally homeless)
attributes.additional_details: Council houses should only be available to those in desperate need of local support and/or because they're facing homelessness and then when they're back on their feet and are able to afford to either private rent or get a mortgage, the council should assist them with this, & then this council house can then be made available again for those who really need it. (Also need a large nationwide building programme to reimburse the council House stock, & until then the Right To Buy should be stopped)

attributes.action: Stop the scrapping of The Armed Forces Retention Bonus.
attributes.background:
After the publication of the New Employment Model across the armed forces, retention and morale has taken a critical blow.

I urge the government and MOD to rethink its strategy to revoke all commitment bonuses in 2021 in order to prevent further damage.
attributes.additional_details:
JSP 754, Part 2, Chapter 6, Section 2.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/514120/20160330_NEM-Pay16_Booklet_Rev_300316.pdf

attributes.action: Allow Donald trump free access to the UK during his presidency.
attributes.background:
Many people have been asking to ban him ? Why?

People are in outrage over a temporary ban that had been twisted by the media, Obama did this in 2011 where was his ban petition.

Please deny all future ban requests.

attributes.action: Discipline and fine MP's who sleep during in session parliamentary proceedings.
attributes.background: As private sector employees would face disciplinary proceedings if they were found to be sleeping on the job, the British government should have rules in place to discipline and substantially fine MP's who sleep on the job.  Numerous photos and videos have emerged of MP's sleeping in parliament.

attributes.action: Make parents who prevent other parents seeing there child liable for court fees
attributes.background: I believe that any parent who prevents the other parent seeing their child/children without a valid reason should be held liable for any court costs, if it goes to court.
attributes.additional_details: Myself and my daughter’s mum split up during the pregnancy. At first everything was fine, despite us no longer being together we still had regular contact regarding the pregnancy. Unfortunately it didn't last and at about 22 weeks into the pregnancy the contact seemed to stop. On numerous occasions I tried making contact with my daughter’s mum but to no avail. I later found out through a 3rd party about my daughter’s birth and despite numerous further attempts, I’ve still had no luck with contact.

attributes.action: Make England have BST during winter and  BST + 1 hour during the summer.
attributes.background:
The advantages include:
-increased daylight during the afternoon.
-energy saving from lighting being delayed, producing reduced carbon emissions;
-reduced roads accidents
-health benefit from afternoon sunlight and outdoor exercise
- benefit the tourist trade
- no cost to UK exchequer
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Society for the Prevention of accidents is in favour of GMT + 1 hour in the winter and GMT + 2 hours in the summer as more people are killed on the road as a result of the earlier afternoon darkness in the winter caused by our current winter time of GMT.

attributes.action: All NHS ambulance trusts to use a life saving database which is free to use
attributes.background: The AUXILIUM SYSTEM was invented and funded after two local girls were killed on the way to and from school. The database was developed over several years from discussion with many Doctors Paramedics, Ambulance Hub Personnel etc. The database will be free for the NHS to use now and forever.
attributes.additional_details: If a person wearing an AUXILIUM number is found unconscious the number can be read to an ambulance call centre, then person’s information is relayed to paramedics regarding the patient before the paramedics arrive on the scene. .The AUXILIUM number costs only £1 per year per person, and you can change as many times as you wish .AUXILIUM has offered around 1,000,000 lifesaving numbers to charities and is now able to offer all schools in the UK a free number for all their pupils around 8 million.

attributes.action: Change the legislation regarding the trapping and killing of foxes and wildlife
attributes.background: Currently it is legal to trap foxes and other wildlife in snares and cages and then kill them "humanely." The very act of trapping and killing a wild animal is inhumane and is cruelty at it's best. The law should only allow farmers the right to kill an animal if said animal is causing problems.
attributes.additional_details: Hunters and generally nasty people are using these laws to trap foxes for training their dogs to hunt and kill. Hunting in this country is absolutely pointless and is purely to fulfill a sick ego. If we had bears and predatory animals roaming our streets then hunting would make more sense. The cruelty one can impose on an animal is merely a snapshot into their psyche and gives evidence they are not mentally healthy people who would not think much about inflicting pain on another human.

attributes.action: Make the police buy cars that are made in the UK and stop buying premium brands.
attributes.background: The UK has a large number of people employed in the automotive industry,  buying UK built cars helps secure UK jobs,  there is no need for the police to have  expensive BMW imported cars and Jaguar premium brand UK cars when a Vauxhall for example make a cheaper alternative that is made in the UK.

attributes.action: Regulate to ensure all rental properties are toxic mould and fungus free
attributes.background: Many of us are living in rented accommodation unfit for habitation. Toxic mould and fungus are lethal and nobody should be in that environment. I believe it is a breach of our human rights and breaks rules set out in our tenancy agreements, yet we are helpless and move from one place to the next.
attributes.additional_details: It sounds bizarre but nobody is regulating this. I'm not talking about a bit of condensation, I'm talking about when the building you live in is rotten. I'm talking about the landlords that paint over various toxic mould and damp problems to move a new tenant in so months later a jungle of danger grows back through, all the while a network of fungus roots start to form beneath the floor and then you have mushrooms sprouting. Tough regulation and penalties are needed to stop estate agents, landlords, freeholders, from making us ill.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Service to calculate payments based on annual basic net pay.
attributes.background: Calculations shouldn't include overtime, shift allowances nor any bonuses.
attributes.additional_details: Receiving parents to provide evidence of what they spend child maintenance on

attributes.action: Reinstate pension age of 65 men 60 women for British citizens above 50 years old
attributes.background: Government greatly reduced the level of state pension paid with recent reform. This asks Government to reverse that decision for all people over the age of 50 years who have made a major contribution to their own state pension only to see it stolen away in the last years of their working lives.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for Students
attributes.background:
In a world where equal opportunity and equality are valued. I see it unfair that millions of students suffering from Mental Disabilities such as ADHD are required to pay for their prescriptions.

Students have limited funds and I feel that those funds should be spent on books, not their medication
attributes.additional_details:
Currently I myself have to pay for my medication, I pay £8.60 for my medication to help treat my ADHD. Paying for the tablets that put them on par with those not suffering from mental disabilities is something that millions of students are facing.
1 in 6 adults have a common mental disorder (CMD), and those of which who are students are occasionally, like myself, facing the choice; food or medication.
This is something I believe should be a thing of the past

attributes.action: Make the day after Remembrance Sunday a Bank Holiday to honour our Armed Forces
attributes.background: The day after Remembrance Sunday should be made a Bank Holiday every year to honour Britain’s war dead and Armed Forces. Many other countries pay tribute to their Armed Forces with a national holiday including the United States, Canada, Russia, France and Israel.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to label their environmental impact on packaging
attributes.background: The same way we have warnings on packs of cigarettes, we need to inform consumers on the negative effects some of their purchase have on the planet. As a start, we request "Palm Oil Kills" warnings (text & picture) covering 13% of front & back of packaging for products using unsustainable palm oil.
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of palm oil plantations are developed at the expense of biodiversity and ecosystems in the countries it is produced. Currently, a third of all mammal species in Indonesia are considered to be critically endangered as a consequence. Over 90% of orangutan habitat has been destroyed in the last 20 years and is considered “a conservation emergency” by the UN. An estimated 1000-5000 orangutans are killed each year for this development. More information can be found online.

attributes.action: More of the foreign aid budget should be funded towards WASH Projects globally.
attributes.background: Priti Patel, the Secretary of State for International Development said British aid money had previously been wasted and stolen. Funds as such could have been used towards Water And Sanitation Hygiene Projects; which would work towards the Global Goal 6, ensuring the availability of water to everyone
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government provide 0.7% of the Gross National Income to International aid. Most of this money is spent on educating children, immunisation, refugees and encouraging global action on climate change. However the water crisis is a significantly problematic issue, as 1 in 9 people do not have access to clean water and adequate sanitation, which kills 5,000 children daily.This leads to a lack of education and rapid spread of diseases, forcing families to fall further into extreme poverty.

attributes.action: Have a progressive capital gains tax in the U.K for high net worth individuals.
attributes.background: Only wealthy people make large gains on their assets; yet they pay the same as working people earning £11,000 to £43,000 per year; this is obviously unfair and perpetuates inequality. Let's create a fairer society where our taxes don't benefit the wealthy and everyone really pays their fair share.
attributes.additional_details:
The FTSE 100 average yearly gain is 5.4% (Motley Fool UK).  Yet average yearly earning income increases between 2001 and 2016 is just 2.3% (ONS). Clearly a CGT rate of 20% benefits the wealthy.
CGT shouldn't change for companies, only for high net worth individuals. Capital investment is essential to our economy; and individuals won't be put off investing if they have to pay 40% on their profits like everyone else. Changing CGT would improve inequality and provide revenue for the government.

attributes.action: Make Bioptic Lenses acceptable for achieving the eyesight standard for driving.
attributes.background: Bioptic Lenses are small optical scopes, that are mounted onto the spectacle frame, to help people with sight loss see extra detail in distant objects or texts. Often used to assist visually impaired individuals that still have a functional level of vision to complete everyday tasks such as driving.
attributes.additional_details: Bioptic driving began over 30 years ago in the US and is currently accepted in over 37 states as well as several European Countries, for both car and motorcycle licenses.  Current UK standards for driving have taken away the freedom and independence of thousands of individuals that would otherwise pose no additional risk to road users.  Consideration, in particular, should be given to those with stable non-progressive visual disorders, where Bioptics would allow them to meet the vision standard.

attributes.action: Allow rape victims to receive forensic examination and results before reporting
attributes.background: Potential rape victims often can't find out whether they have ingested a date rape drug unless they take legal action and report the crime. This involves undergoing a 3 hour forensic examination, making a video statement, and the arrest of the accused. They may also be forced to appear in court.
attributes.additional_details: Date rape drugs leave the system within 72 hours of being ingested, and forensic examinations should be made within this time frame too, so that the victim can eat, drink and shower normally. The decision to report is heavy, and should be given time. When forced to make a decision so quickly, victims are often pressured into reporting their crimes when it isn't in their interest to do so. Victims should have the right to receive the forensic examination and its results before reporting.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of the Zeilsdorf Family from Laggan.
attributes.background: The family are waiting for imminent deportation as they have failed to meet the criteria of their Entrepreneur Visa by employing 2 people in their tiny shop and coffee bothy in Laggan. They do employ 1, they have 3 children, and take care of the local rural community by providing a valuable service.
attributes.additional_details: They are being forced to leave before they can sell. There's every chance that the business will not continue and the area will lose it's shop. Other similar services are tens of miles away. Their children are Scottish, they employ someone, and they make regular visits to local elderly and house bound people in the community as Jason was a Pastor. It is not the Highlands, Scotland or Scottish people who don't want and them; it is just the Home Office. We NEED them - sign  to keep the Zeilsdorfs.

attributes.action: Allow freedom of movement to continue within the tech sector
attributes.background: The UK has a skills shortage when it comes to tech, and in order for us to remain the digital capital of Europe. We must allow talent to come easily into the UK. A complicated visa process will mean that talent goes elsewhere and we suffer as a result of it.

attributes.action: Require universities to provide night-time safety to stop sexual harassment
attributes.background: Improve safety around the University at night for women and men when traveling and walking around the site.

attributes.action: Stop the Government ripoff on car road tax transfer return to old system
attributes.background: when a car is sold in the middle of the month the owner losses two weeks road tax refund and the new owner has to pay from the beginning of the month  paying for two weeks he/she has not had,so the GOV.is stealing four weeks road tax, return to the old system where the road tax can stay with the car

attributes.action: Stop Theresa May allowing schools to wholly discriminate based on religion
attributes.background: Theresa May wishes to relax the school admission rules to allow them to select every child from one religion. Creating environments where children would not come into contact with a children from a different background to themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
The complete segregation of children will encourage a more disparate society in the future, with less understanding of each other.

Schools should exist to educate - not to encourage tribalism. 

Furthermore; religious schools do not allow a free, independent arena for children to learn to question. When a child receives religion from a place of worship, home and school - there is no space to form an independent opinion. It's tantamount to brain washing.

attributes.action: Implement a detection system to stop parental abduction of children leaving U.K
attributes.background: The government needs to implement a no nonsense approach to stopping one parent abducting a child to another country at Airports and all points of travel especially holiday seasons. Systems as such already exist in Canada, US and even in the Middle East.
attributes.additional_details:
Government needs to make sure kids cannot leave from the U.K without the consent of both parents 
"Nobody asked if he had my permission to take her" 
Sarah Taylor Rise in parental child abductions 
Foreign Office figures that show that the number of British children abducted by a parent and taken overseas has increased in the past year. 
A mother's lengthy search for her kidnapped child-http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk

attributes.action: Introduce periodic retention elections for the judges of the UK Supreme Court.
attributes.background: Periodic retention elections would enable Supreme Court judges to be  removed from office by popular vote if their judgements were deemed to be improper or to subvert government and the will of the people.
attributes.additional_details: Such elections are already used by the Supreme Courts of many US states to make judges accountable to the people.  Thus there is already a successful working precedent for such elections.

attributes.action: Keep EU students fees in line with UK students post-Brexit.
attributes.background: With the uncertainties thrust upon the nation we, the undersigned, call upon the government to reassure EU students that they are welcome and to commit to keeping their fees in line with UK students.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government were to commit to such an action it would be a clear message to the world that the UK is not anti-immigrant and that it welcomes, and values, the diversity and contributions of all people regardless of their nationality.

Additionally, it would show that this government is not going to use people's live as bargaining tools in the upcoming Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: Allow all those who didn't or couldn't vote in the EU Referendum a second vote
attributes.background: Just less than 28% of registered Britain's did not vote in the June EU referendum, leave's margin of victory was 1,269,501 votes, that means 13 million potential voters for whatever reason, did not participate, they should be given the democratic right to a vote to verify the referendum outcome.

attributes.action: Give a life sentence for sexually assaulting a child.
attributes.background: A belief that the criminal justice system can do more to deter child sex offenders. There is universal agreement that there has been a lack of appropriate sentencing handed out to pedophiles in Britain.

attributes.action: Review and reform behavior during debates within the House of Commons.
attributes.background: Many citizens of this country are  appalled by the jeering, cheering, and most unacceptably, laughter that characterizes PMQs and every other debate that takes place in the chamber at The House of Commons. This childish behavior demonstrates a general disinterest in engaging in robust debate.
attributes.additional_details: When the future of this country is being discussed, when welfare cuts that destroy lives and families are being discussed, it is disgusting to see jokes being made and heartily laughed at. General disorder slows the processes of power and disrupts the scrutiny of government. An immediate review and reform of the guidelines of MPs parliamentary behavior should be enacted. Those who cannot behave in a way befitting the seriousness of political discourse should be disciplined.

attributes.action: Invest in more Gender Clinics around the UK
attributes.background: There are currently two Gender Clinics in the UK - one in London and one in Leeds. The waiting list for both clinics can be up to 18 months, sometimes even longer, because of the increase in acceptance and openness about gender identity.
attributes.additional_details: I was referred to Tavistock in London in April/May 2016 and my referral got accepted around November 2016, I am still currently waiting for an appointment 9/10 months on from my referral date. From personal experience, the NHS are an incredible asset to the UK and without it we'd undeniably be in a much worse position. However, Gender Clinics are very far stretched and I struggle with the wait hugely which has major impacts on my mental health. I'm not the only one with this issue, fact.

attributes.action: Open an inquiry into Atos/Maximus and the work capability assessment
attributes.background: There should be an independent inquiry into the work capability assessments carried out by ATOS and MAXIMUS. We need to know more about the terms of the contracts to know whether they are selling our data. We need to know how many people have died because of their actions.
attributes.additional_details: The “health care professionals” employed by these companies, who work directly for the DWP, should listen to the consultants. They say that seriously ill people are fit for work, and some have died within the space of a year. These contracted companies are paid £1.6 billion. These are foreign companies who get rich off the British taxpayer. There is no concern for Disabled persons in the UK.

attributes.action: Make screening for group B strep a routine screen for women during pregnancy.
attributes.background: Group B streptococcus is a bacteria which lives inside the body and is carried by one in three expectant mothers. The bug can be potentially life-threatening to babies. In the UK, pregnant women are not routinely offered testing for group B Strep, unlike some other developed countries.
attributes.additional_details: Infection from mum to baby is entirely preventable. The test is carried out 35 to 37 weeks. You are given antibiotics in labour to help the baby fight the infection. Many women carry the bacteria. It causes no harm at all but in pregnancy as the baby comes down the birth canal it can pick up the bacteria.

attributes.action: Offer U.K. citizenship to all E.U. citizens with permanent residence status
attributes.background:
There are many eu citizens who have built a life for themselves in this country over many years. Their children may have been educated here, they may bought property or married u.k. citizens,.
as things stand despite all they have contributed they face an uncertain future. They deserve security

attributes.action: Schools to allow pupils with excellent attendance, holidays during term time.
attributes.background: Taking a summer or winter holiday during half term or end of term, is incredibly expensive when you have children.  Holiday companies monopolise on parents like me every year, to the point where we sometimes just cannot afford to go away. I want the Government to consider a fair way to address this.
attributes.additional_details: Children with excellent attendance records should be able to take up to two weeks holiday per year (subject to the school agreeing the timings) to spend quality time away with their family.  I have a family of 5 and for us to camp in France in August will cost around £3,500 just for travel (by ferry) and accommodation (mobile home).  Nothing lavish, but very expensive when you throw in spending money too.  If we did this in May or June, it works out at £1200!  This seems so unfair for Parents.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to approve Nivolumab for lung cancer patients
attributes.background: Denied by Nice in England and Wales, this drug is freely available in Scotland. This drug could help cure patients suffering from Lung cancer, yet the government won't allow its use. Sign today lets start changing this disgrace immediately

attributes.action: Apply to rejoin EFTA & retain EEA membership as objective of Art 50 negotiations
attributes.background: We call on HMG to aim for a practical workable realistic outcome in negotiations with the EU. To that end, rejoining EFTA & remaining in the EEA is the only sensible initial route. Any other approach will waste time, to the detriment of us all.

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying/online threats to be recognised as a serious crime.
attributes.background: There are too many people these days taking their own life due to online threats, bullying etc. If you have ever been to the police about online threats they generally will tell you they cannot help and this needs to stop. It needs to be investigated properly, this will lead to lives being saved.
attributes.additional_details:
Online bullying/threats have become a major problem as technology advances, so how many more people need to take their lives before anything changes?

Some facts in the UK about cyber bullying:
There were over 11,000 counselling sessions with young people who talked to Childline about online issues last year
More than 16,000 young people are absent from school due to bullying.
20% of people who experience cyber bullying contemplate suicide, 1 in 10 attempt it.
